decision_conditions: The development to which this permission relates must be commenced not later than three years from the date of this permission.
To comply with the requirements of Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended by Section 51 of the Planning and Compulsory Purchase Act 2004).

The development hereby approved shall be implemented in accordance with the acoustic report VA3107.200121, dated 22.01.2020. The sound proofing scheme shall incorporate a secondary internal door which should not be opened whilst the external door is opened. During the operation of the use no windows or door shall remain opened. The level of noise shall not exceed the predicted noise level as indicated in the acoustic report. Thereafter the sound insulation and acoustic barriers shall be retained and maintained.

To minimise the impact of the development on the surrounding area in the interests of amenity, and that the development accords with the Development Control Policies Development Plan Document Policy DC61.
The use hereby approved shall only be used between hours of 10:00am and 22:00 daily.

To minimise the impact of the development on the surrounding area in the interests of amenity, and that the development accords with the Development Control Policies Development Plan Document Policy DC61.

Statement Required by Article 35(2) of the Town and Country Planning (Development Management) Order 2015: during the course of the process the applicant were to required to provide appropriate acoustic report to assess the impact of noise from the proposed use. Other than noise issue no other significant problems were identified during the consideration of the application, and therefore it has been determined in accordance with paragraph 38 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2018.
description: Change of use from B1,B2,B8 to sui generis,   to turn a warehouse from light industrial/warehousing to a sports facility - for target sports
